HDG.IM.content: [for Derrida, etymology serves dissemination] must grasp fully last remnant [verbliebenen Rest] of a connection [Bezugs] to Being (now that word is empty) [trace]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: [for Derrida, etymology serves dissemination] must grasp fully last remnant [verbliebenen Rest] of a connection [Bezugs] to Being (now that word is empty) [trace]

HDG.IM.content: from 3 etymological stems of Being: living, emerging, abiding [compare how Heidegger uses etymology to Derrida, dissemination] > different meanings imply experiences > Nothing arises merely through loss [re: not tracing how the different meanings grow together into one verb] [annihilation of trace?]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.IM.linkedContent: from 3 etymological stems of Being: living, emerging, abiding [compare how Heidegger uses etymology to Derrida, dissemination] > different meanings imply experiences > Nothing arises merely through loss [re: not tracing how the different meanings grow together into one verb] [annihilation of trace?]

HDG.IM.content: essence of Being [?] already lit itself up, but remains unquestioned > is Being evaporating into indifference? or is Being most worthy of questioning? > question of Being is not a matter of grammar & etymology [?]: language at stake in a special way

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.IM.linkedContent: essence of Being [?] already lit itself up, but remains unquestioned > is Being evaporating into indifference? or is Being most worthy of questioning? > question of Being is not a matter of grammar & etymology [?]: language at stake in a special way

HDG.DL.content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)
